Uses of Package
suncertify.db

Packages that use suncertify.db
suncertify These are the classes that provide basic application functionality. 
suncertify.db These are the classes that provide database functionality to the data file. 
suncertify.sockets These are the classes that provide network connectivity between the client and the server using Serialized Objects over Sockets. 
 

Classes in suncertify.db used by suncertify
DBAccess
          Interface DBAccess is a Data Access Interface
Classes which work with the database must implement this interface.
 

Classes in suncertify.db used by suncertify.db
Data
          Class Data implements interface DBAccess provides methods to operate a database file on local hard drive.
DBAccess
          Interface DBAccess is a Data Access Interface
Classes which work with the database must implement this interface.
DuplicateKeyException
          A DuplicateKeyException is class of exception that must be thrown when newly created record in data file has the same unique key that another existing record has.
Finalizable
          Interface Finalizable must implemented by classes that have clean up functionality.
RecordNotFoundException
          A RecordNotFoundException is a class of exception that must be thrown when user wants to gain access to the record with number that does not exist in database file.
SecurityException
          A SecurityException class of exception that must be thrown when user tries to modify or delete record and uses invalid locking cookie.
 

Classes in suncertify.db used by suncertify.sockets
DBAccess
          Interface DBAccess is a Data Access Interface
Classes which work with the database must implement this interface.
DuplicateKeyException
          A DuplicateKeyException is class of exception that must be thrown when newly created record in data file has the same unique key that another existing record has.
RecordNotFoundException
          A RecordNotFoundException is a class of exception that must be thrown when user wants to gain access to the record with number that does not exist in database file.
SecurityException
          A SecurityException class of exception that must be thrown when user tries to modify or delete record and uses invalid locking cookie.
